justification: Participants reported their confidence in judging avalanche risk using a 7-point scale, assessing their subjective degree of belief in their judgment, as indicated in the Procedure section of the paper.

The degree of safety judged by participants was evaluated through three specific questions about the perception of safety and danger in skiing conditions on a 7-point scale, detailed in the Procedure section.

Affective evaluations were measured through participants rating the attractiveness, uninterestingness (reverse-scored), and enjoyability of the scenario on a 7-point scale, as elaborated in the Methodology.

Experience in backcountry skiing was quantified as a mean score considering skiing ability, avalanche training, years of experience, and average days of skiing per season, as mentioned in the analysis section of the paper.
